chapter.title: Storage Domains
chapter.para: The storagedomains collection provides information about the storage domains in a Red Hat Enterprise Virtualization environment. An API user accesses this information through the rel="storagedomains" link obtained from the entry point URI (see ).
The following table shows specific elements contained in a storage domain resource representation.

note.title: Element property icons
note.para: The icons used in the properties column of this table are described in

row.entry: A link to the sub-collection for storage domain permissions. See
A link to the files sub-collection for this storage domains
A link to the vms sub-collection for a storage domain with type set to export
A link to the templates sub-collection for a storage domain with type set to export
The storage domain type. A list of enumerated values are available in capabilities. See .

A reference to the host on which this storage domain should be initialized. The only restriction on this host is that it should have access to the physical storage specified.

example.title: An XML representation of a storage domain

chapter.para: Creation of a new storage domain requires the name, type and storage properties. See for more information.

example.title: Creating a storage domain
example.screen:
POST /restapi-definition/storagedomains HTTP/1.1 Accept: application/xml Content-type: application/xml
<storage_domain> <name>data1</name> <type>data</type> <storage> <type>nfs</type> <address>172.31.0.6</address> <path>/exports/RHEVX/images/0</path> </storage> </storage_domain>

chapter.para: Only the name element is updatable post-creation. See for more information.

example.title: Updating a storage domain
example.screen:
PUT /restapi-definition/storagedomains HTTP/1.1 Accept: application/xml Content-type: application/xml
<storage_domain> <name>data2</name> ... </storage_domain>

chapter.para: Removal of a storage domain requires a DELETE request.
The API user attaches the storage domain to a data center after creation. See for instructions.

section.title: Storage types
section.para: The storage element contains a type element, which is an enumerated value found under the capabilities collection. See .
The storage element also contains additional elements specific to each storage type. The next few section examine these additional storage type elements.

section.title: NFS
section.para: The nfs specific elements in a storage description are:

row.entry: The host name or IP address of the NFS server
The path of NFS mountable directory on the server

section.title: iSCSI and FCP
section.para: The iscsi and fcp specific elements in a storage description are:

row.entry: The id of the logical unit. A storage domain also accepts multiple iSCSI or FCP logical units

section.para: The logical_unit contains the following elements:

row.entry: The address of the server containing the storage device
The port number of the server
The target IQN for the storage device
A CHAP user name for logging into a target
A CHAP password for logging into a target
The serial ID for the target
The vendor name for the target
The product code for the target
The Logical Unit Number device mapping for the target

section.para: In the case of iSCSI, if a logical_unit description also contains details of the iSCSI target with the LUN in question, the target performs an automatic login when the storage domain is created.

section.title: LocalFS
section.para: The localfs specific elements in a storage description are:

row.entry: The path of local storage domain on the host

section.para: A localfs storage domain requires a data center with storage_type set to localfs (see ). This data center only contains a single host cluster, and the host cluster only contains a single host.

section.title: Export Storage Domains
section.para: Storage domains with type set to export contain vms and templates sub-collections, which list the import candidate VMs and templates stored on that particular storage domain.

example.title: Listing the virtual machines sub-collection of an export storage domain
example.screen:
GET /restapi-definition/storagedomains/fabe0451-701f-4235-8f7e-e20e458819ed/vms Accept: application/xml
<vms> <vm id="082c794b-771f-452f-83c9-b2b5a19c0399" href="/restapi-definition/storagedomains/fabe0451-701f-4235-8f7e-e20e458819ed/ vms/082c794b-771f-452f-83c9-b2b5a19c0399"> <name>vm1</name> ... <storage_domain id="fabe0451-701f-4235-8f7e-e20e458819ed" href="/restapi-definition/storagedomains/fabe0451-701f-4235-8f7e-e20e458819ed"/> <actions> <link rel="import" href="/restapi-definition/storagedomains/ fabe0451-701f-4235-8f7e-e20e458819ed/vms/ 082c794b-771f-452f-83c9-b2b5a19c0399/import"/> </actions> </vm> </vms>

section.para: VMs and templates in these collections have a similar representation to their counterparts in the top-level VMs and templates collection, except they also contain a storage_domain reference and an import action.
The import action imports a virtual machine or a template from an export storage domain. The destination cluster and storage domain is specified with cluster and storage_domain references.

example.title: Action to import a virtual machine from an export storage domain
example.screen:
POST /restapi-definition/storagedomains/fabe0451-701f-4235-8f7e-e20e458819ed/vms/ 082c794b-771f-452f-83c9-b2b5a19c0399/import HTTP/1.1 Accept: application/xml Content-type: application/xml
<action> <storage_domain> <name>images0</name> </storage_domain> <cluster> <name>Default</name> </cluster> </action>

example.title: Action to import a template from an export storage domain
example.screen:
POST /restapi-definition/storagedomains/fabe0451-701f-4235-8f7e-e20e458819ed/templates/ 082c794b-771f-452f-83c9-b2b5a19c0399/import HTTP/1.1 Accept: application/xml Content-type: application/xml
<action> <storage_domain> <name>images0</name> </storage_domain> <cluster> <name>Default</name> </cluster> </action>

section.para: Delete a virtual machine or template from an export storage domain with a DELETE request.

example.title: Delete virtual machine from an export storage domain
example.screen:
DELETE /restapi-definition/storagedomains/fabe0451-701f-4235-8f7e-e20e458819ed/vms/ 082c794b-771f-452f-83c9-b2b5a19c0399 HTTP/1.1 Accept: application/xml
HTTP/1.1 204 No Content

section.title: Files Sub-Collection
section.para: The files sub-collection under each storage domain provides a way for clients to list available files. This sub-collection is specifically targeted to ISO storage domains, which contain ISO images and virtual floppy disks (VFDs) that an administrator uploads through Red Hat Enterprise Virtualization Manager.
The addition of a CD-ROM device to a VM requires an ISO image from the files sub-collection of an ISO storage domain.

example.title: Listing the files sub-collection of an ISO storage domain
example.screen:
GET /restapi-definition/storagedomains/00f0d9ce-da15-4b9e-9e3e-3c898fa8b6da/files HTTP/1.1 Accept: application/xml
<files> <file id="en_winxp_pro_with_sp2.iso" href="/restapi-definition/storagedomains/00f0d9ce-da15-4b9e-9e3e-3c898fa8b6da/files/ en_winxp_pro_with_sp2.iso"> <name>en_winxp_pro_with_sp2.iso</name> <type>iso</type> <storage_domain id="00f0d9ce-da15-4b9e-9e3e-3c898fa8b6da" href="/restapi-definition/storagedomains/00f0d9ce-da15-4b9e-9e3e-3c898fa8b6da"/> </file> <file id="boot.vfd" href="/restapi-definition/storagedomains/00f0d9ce-da15-4b9e-9e3e-3c898fa8b6da/files/ boot.vfd"> <name>boot.vfd</name> <type>vfd</type> <storage_doman id="00f0d9ce-da15-4b9e-9e3e-3c898fa8b6da" href="/restapi-definition/storagedomains/00f0d9ce-da15-4b9e-9e3e-3c898fa8b6da"/> </file> </files>

section.para: Like other resources, files have opaque id and href attributes. The name element contains the filename.

section.title: Import Existing Storage Domain
section.para: The API provides a user with the ability to remove an ISO or Export storage domain from one Red Hat Enterprise Virtualization Manager instance without re-formatting the underlying storage and import it into another instance. Importing is achieved similarly to adding a new storage domain, except the name is not specified.

example.title: Importing an Exisiting Export Storage Domain
example.screen:
POST /restapi-definition/storagedomains HTTP/1.1 Accept: application/xml Content-Type: application/xml
<storage_domain> <type>export</type> <storage> <type>nfs</type> <address>172.31.0.6</address> <path>/exports/RHEVX/export-domain</path> </storage> <host id="2ab5e1da-b726-4274-bbf7-0a42b16a0fc3"/> </storage_domain>
HTTP/1.1 201 Created Location: http://{host}/storagedomains/fabe0451-701f-4235-8f7e-e20e458819ed Content-Type: application/xml
<storage_domain id="fabe0451-701f-4235-8f7e-e20e458819ed" href="/restapi-definition/storagedomains/fabe0451-701f-4235-8f7e-e20e458819ed"> <name>export1</name> ... </storage_domain>

section.title: Delete Storage Domain
section.para: A storage_domain reference is passed in the body of a DELETE request for a storage domain. The storage_domain reference is in the following form:
OR
The API user provides a optional format element to specify whether or not to format the storage domain after deletion.

example.title: Formating a Storage Domain after Deletion

section.para: If no format element is passed, the storage domain remains unformatted.
